result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquis D Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marquis D Hudson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marquis D Hudson was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
This sentence is to commence forthwith. This sentence is to be served concurrent to any reconfinement that occurs in Milwaukee Co. case 03CF35--State of Wisconsin v. Marquis D. Hudson.

10/27/15: The Court orders the JOC be amended to reflect 245 days sentence credit, all other aspects are to remain the same.

The Court does not order Mr. Hudson to provide a DNA sample since he has already provided one.

Case called at 1:05pm [mo]
Defendant Marquis D Hudson in court, in custody with Attorney Stephen R. Kramer.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

DA Happ informs the Court that Count #1 had been dismissed at the Preliminary Hearing/Arraignment.

On Joint stipulation from the Parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Counts #3 and #4

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Hudson guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Kramer
Statement made by Mr. Hudson

On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Hudson to 3 years & 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years. 
This sentence is to commence forthwith. This sentence is to be served concurrent to any reconfinement that occurs in Milwaukee Co. case 03CF35--State of Wisconsin v. Marquis D. Hudson. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives 255 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--Conditions are at the discretion of the Department of Corrections
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

The Court does not order Mr. Hudson to provide a DNA sample since he has already provided one. 

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence given 
recess: 1:40pm
Motion hearing on June 1, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Case called at 11:28 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for motion hearing)
Defendant Marquis D Hudson in court, in-custody, with Attorney Stephen R. Kramer. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
VIctim Rights Compliance Verified; Court so finds
Atty Kramer informs the Court that he was appointed by SPD in January - have been numerous communications with DA Happ regarding this case. Have been preparing for trial & thought knew Mr. Hudson's position on settlement and those parameters. Mr. Hudson agreed to settlement last week, informed DA Happ to call off witnesses and informed Court's JA that motions would be withdrawn & would be plea/sentencing. Agreement is no longer agreeable to Mr. Hudson. Do believe there are irreconcilable differences and do no believe can continue appointment.
DA Happ confirms that witnesses were not called off for trial, but for today's motion hearing
Mr. Hudson informs the Court that he believes Atty Kramer has done a good job on case - but do not agree with how he has communicated to him. 
Court explains options to Mr. Hudson re: counsel
Mr. Hudson informs the Court that it was not his idea to have Atty Kramer removed from case
Atty Kramer informs the Court that he would be willing to continue on matter; harm done is that motion can not be heard today
Court informs parties that It will hear motions at final pre-trial & work around that calendar as witnesses are still available for trial
Court informs Mr. Hudson that Atty Kramer may not have further discussions with the State re: settlement
Mr. Hudson informs the Court that if this is the case, would like different attorney
DA Happ informs the Court that they have made their final offer, will not be changing offer as is concurrent recommendation
Court explains further for Mr. Hudson - Counsel again discuss settlement attempts with case
Court believes Atty Kramer will be able to adequately represnt Mr. Hudson at trial, incident between parties does not affect ability to work together
Court informs Mr. Hudson that he is not to direct Atty Kramer back to State for better offer as it has been made clear that no other offer will be made in this case and that no further negotiations will be held and that he should be prepared to proceed with trial as scheduled. Motions will be heard at FSSC and plea may still be entered if desired.
DA Happ informs the Court that she can not confirm witness availability at this time for motion 
Court informs parties that if witnesses are not available for FSSC date, then counsel are to get together and discuss alternate date and schedule with Court's JA
Recess: 11:48 am 

NEXT: Case to remain as scheduled for trial - Motion hearing to be rescheduled for FSSC date - Send notices

Case called at 10:25 [MO & MK]
Defendant Marquis D Hudson and attorney Stephen R. Kramer via video conferencing from Jefferson County Jail. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
On agreement of Counsel, the Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. Kramer indicates he has requested full discovery. Atty. Kramer indicates that Mr. Hudson has other more serious cases pending in Milwaukee County. 
The Court indicates to Counsel that it does not intend to await the Milwaukee County case outcomes. The Court is setting this case for trial now. 
The Court orders the State to provide discovery to the Defense by 2/13/2015. ADA Shock indicates that Discovery was mailed yesterday. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. ADA Shock verifies victim right compliance. 

Recess:10:31am

NEXT: (1) FSSC: 4/20/2015 at 11:00am (2) Jury Trial 4/23/2015 OR 4/24/2015 at 8:30am

case called at 9:38am. [MK]
Defendant Marquis D Hudson in court, in custody, with Attorney Robert E Webb.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Information admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
After Mr. Hudson inquires about Count #1 being charged as a felony, the Court cites its rulings at the Preliminary Hearing and notes that the State has not filed additional authority as it had been allowed to do.  
On Motion of Attorney Webb, the Court dismisses Count #1.
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered on Counts #2, #3, #4.

The Court grants Attorney Webb's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel.  
The Court reviews right to counsel with Mr. Hudson, referring him to apply at the Public Defender for representation.  
recess 9:45am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/21/15 at 3:20pm.  (2) case is referred to Branch III for further scheduling

case called at 9:28am. [MK]
Defendant Marquis D Hudson in court, in custody, with Attorney Robert E Webb.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Officer Jessica Bushkie- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--State's Exhibit #1: disk of v-view body camera footage is shown - exhibit is offered and received
--cross examination by Attorney Webb
--redirect examination by ADA Beck
--examination by the Court

Closing arguments given by counsel. 
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Hudson committed the felony offense of Fleeing, and the Court binds him over for trial.
The Court does not find probable cause that Mr. Hudson committed the felony offense of Escape; the Court amends the charge to Misdemeanor Escape contrary to Statute 946.42(2)(c). 
The Court will reconsider the charge of felony escape if the submits written argument with citation to case law.
The Court informs the parties that this case will transfer to Branch III as of January 1st. 
recess 10:02am.

Case called at 10:49 am (case was set for Preliminary Hearing)
Defendant Marquis D Hudson in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney De La Rosa motions to withdraw as attorney of record.
Defendant informs the court that his family has retained counsel and requests that the preliminary hearing be adjourned to allow that attorney to appear.
DA Happ has no objection to the motion to withdraw or defendant's request to adjourn.
Court grants Attorney De La Rosa's motion to withdraw.
Court allows officer to leave.
Court grants the Defendant's request for adjournment of the preliminary hearing.
Attorney De La Rosa advises the Court that the defendant is still eligible for SPD representation.
10:57 am Attorney De La Rosa exits courtroom

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Defendant requests the preliminary hearing be adjourned for 3 weeks.
Court finds good cause to hold preliminary hearing no sooner than 3 weeks out.

case called at 2:10pm. [Clerk: MK]
Defendant Marquis D Hudson in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing, however ADA Teuber indicates that the State is not prepared to proceed.  ADA Teuber explains that the State was advised that today's hearing would be a waiver, so the witness had been cancelled; when the State then learned that the Defendant intends to proceed to Preliminary Hearing, there was not sufficient time to arrange for the witness to testify today. 

The Court finds good cause to not proceed today and to exceed the ten day time limit. 
The Court and counsel discuss rescheduling. 
recess 2:12pm. 

NEXT:  reschedule Preliminary Hearing to October 16th at 10:45am. before Judge Wambach
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 1:48 pm
Defendant Marquis D Hudson in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint is correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited (reading of Counts # 3 & #4)
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 CASH bond, with no special conditions.
 
Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Counts #1- #4

Recess: 1:53 pm
